FuncDef: The display mpls mldp lsp p2mp command displays LDP signaling information on mLDP P2MP LSPs.
CLIs: display mpls mldp lsp p2mp [ root-ip <root-ip-address> { lsp-id <lsp-id> | opaque-value <opaque-value> } | name <p2mp-lsp-name> ]

ParaDef.Info:
Displays information about a P2MP LSP with a specified root address.
The value is in dotted decimal notation.

Displays information about a P2MP LSP with a specified LSP ID.
The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 4294967295.

Displays information about a P2MP LSP with a specified opaque value.
The value is a hexadecimal string of 1 to 254 characters.

Displays information about a P2MP LSP with a specified name.
The value is a string of 1 to 31 case-sensitive characters. It cannot contain spaces. When double quotation marks are used around the string, spaces are allowed in the string.

Examples: An asterisk (*) before a Label means the USCB or DSCB is stale
An asterisk (*) before a Peer means the session is stale
Out Label  Peer              MBB State     Next Hop        Out Interface
<HUAWEI> display mpls mldp lsp p2mp root-ip 1.1.1.9 lsp-id 32769
In Label Peer         MBB State     New Root        New Opaque Value
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To view local mLDP P2MP LSP information, run the display mpls mldp lsp p2mp command. The command output helps check whether P2MP LSPs are successfully established using LDP signaling. The command output only contains information about successfully established P2MP LSPs.
